result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey L Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court does not oppose sentence and probation being transferred to Marathon County

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessment to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at the discretion of the agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey L Larsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served if revoked.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

Court does not oppose sentence and probation being transfered to Marathon County.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 60 days condition time
          in the House of Correction.  This time is to be 
          used at the discretion of the agent.
     *   No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
    *   No alcohol or controlled substances.
    *   Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended. 
    *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and
         pay the DNA surcharge.
    *   No firearms. 
    *   Obtain/maintain employment.
    *   Obtain GED or HSED.
    *   Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by                     DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.   Defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Payment of the surcharges will be addressed on the day of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Co-defendant's case was rescheduled as new counsel was just appointed.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court held sidebar.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Tom Hackbart.  Attorney Craig S. Powell appeared earlier.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk Court grants Attorney Powell's motion to withdraw.  Attorney Hackbart proceeds as new counsel.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR WITHDRAWAL OF COUNSEL. FILED BY CRAIG S. POWELL. kl

Attorney Dan Sanders for Craig S. Powell in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, defendant is not present. Court authorized a bench warrant but stayed the warrant until the next court date. Defense requested a plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  James Frisch for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey L Larsen
Current: 1319 1/2 North 2nd Street, Wausau, WI 54403   (Effective: 06-04-2015)
Prior: 1319 1/2 North 2nd Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Defendant Jeffrey L Larsen in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/4/15 @ 1:30 pm
